portal_hypertension.title: Epidemiology of Compensated Advanced Chronic Liver Disease (cACLD) in the United States: Insights From the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey, 2017-2020.
portal_hypertension.journal: Clinical gastroenterology and hepatology : the official clinical practice journal of the American Gastroenterological Association
portal_hypertension.authors: Goyal RM, Doshi A, Rao S
portal_hypertension.zhSummary: 该文聚焦门静脉高压症，属于临床研究。核心观点：代偿性晚期慢性肝病（cACLD）包括无症状患者的晚期纤维化和肝硬化，这些患者有发生临床上显着的门静脉高压的风险。 临床提示：cACLD 患者失代偿和肝脏相关死亡的风险很高，因此需要进一步评估。
portal_hypertension.abstract: Compensated advanced chronic liver disease (cACLD) encompasses advanced fibrosis and cirrhosis in asymptomatic patients at risk of developing clinically significant portal hypertension. Patients having cACLD are at high risk of decompensation and liver-related mortality and hence require further evaluation. Due to limited epidemiologic data on cACLD, we aimed to assess its prevalence in the United States (U.S.). We performed a cross-sectional study analyzing adults who underwent transient elastography using the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey (NHANES) database from 2017 to March 2020. portal_hypertension.title: Platelet and Doppler ultrasound signatures of histological fibrosis in chronic liver disease: a correlation study based on Ishak staging.
portal_hypertension.authors: Boccatonda A, Garlisi MC, Brighenti A
portal_hypertension.zhSummary: 该文聚焦门静脉高压症，属于临床研究（样本量约为 120）。核心观点：肝纤维化的无创评估仍然是临床肝病学的主要挑战。 临床提示：血小板计数和多普勒超声参数已被提议作为门静脉高压和纤维化重塑的间接标志物，但它们与整个疾病的组织学纤维化严重程度之间的关系
portal_hypertension.abstract: Non-invasive assessment of hepatic fibrosis remains a major challenge in clinical hepatology. Platelet count and Doppler ultrasound parameters have been proposed as indirect markers of portal hypertension and fibrotic remodeling, yet their relationship with histological fibrosis severity across the full disease spectrum is not fully defined. This study aimed to evaluate the associations between platelet count (PLT) and Doppler ultrasound parameters along the histological continuum of hepatic fibrosis assessed by the Ishak staging system. portal_hypertension.title: Atypical Presentation of Downhill Esophageal Varices: A Diagnostic Enigma.
portal_hypertension.authors: Al Annan K, Khan H, Scranton M
portal_hypertension.zhSummary: 该文聚焦门静脉高压症，属于病例研究。核心观点：下坡食管静脉曲张（DEV）是近端食管的罕见血管异常，通常由上腔静脉阻塞引起。 临床提示：我们报道了一名 75 岁男性，他出现间歇性吞咽困难和球状感觉，内窥镜检查显示有大的近端食管静脉曲张。
portal_hypertension.abstract: Downhill esophageal varices (DEV) are rare vascular abnormalities of the proximal esophagus, commonly caused by superior vena cava obstruction. We report a 75-year-old man who presented with intermittent dysphagia and globus sensation, in whom endoscopy demonstrated large proximal esophageal varices. Extensive evaluation excluded portal hypertension and cross-sectional imaging, and venography showed a patent superior vena cava and inferior vena cava but demonstrated right internal jugular vein occlusion with possible azygos system compression. These findings were considered remote and insufficient to explain the extensive proximal varices, which were ultimately classified as idiopathic DEV. ...
